item.title: Securing SSH with the Vault SSH backend and GitHub authentication
item.description: This blog is going to be about using Hashicorp’s Vault to issue short-lived certificates to use with SSH. Most guides have you using a username & password to authenticate with Vault, but I’ve chosen to delegate that to GitHub instead. I’m assuming you already have a Vault server running - I won’t be covering that in the course of this blog. You’ll also need a sufficiently-privileged Vault token, and jq installed on the machine you wish to SSH from.
